intro: Jonesiopsis xantha, commonly known as the yellow Jonesiopsis, is a rare and unique member of the Gesneriaceae family. It is native to specific regions in Southeast Asia, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its striking yellow flowers, which contrast beautifully with its dark green foliage. It has small, ovate leaves that are often covered in a fine, waxy coating. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a delicate and challenging plant to cultivate.
